message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about geological processes. Hydro mechanical wearing refers to the erosion and wearing away of rocks and landforms due to the force of water. Over the lifetime of the planet, this process can create crevasses, which are narrow, deep cracks or fissures in the Earth's surface. Option (B) is incorrect because hydro mechanical wearing does not directly create oceans. Options (C) and (D) are unrelated to the wearing of the planet's surface.
